sen.j: 人見 勝太郎（ひとみ かつたろう、天保14年10月9日 (旧暦)(1843年11月30日) - 大正11年(1922年)12月31日）は、江戸時代末期の幕臣、明治期の官僚・実業家。
sen.e: Katsutaro HITOMI (born on November 30, 1843 and died on December 31, 1922) was a vassal of Tokugawa Shogunate in the Edo period and a bureaucrat and businessman in the Meiji period.
Katsutaro HITOMI (born on November 30, 1843 and died on December 31, 1922) was a vassal of Tokugawa Shogunate in the end of Edo period and a bureaucrat and businessman in the Meiji period.
Katsutaro HITOMI (born on November 30, 1843 and died on December 31, 1922) was a vassal of Tokugawa Shogunate in the end of Edo period and a bureaucrat and businessman in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 維新後は寧（やすし）。
sen.e: He changed his name into Yasushi after the Meiji Restoration.
He changed his name into Yasushi after the Meiji Restoration.
He changed his name into Yasushi after the Meiji Restoration.

sen.j: 雅号は梅坪。
sen.e: Another name was Umetsubo.
His Gago (pseudonym) was Umetsubo.
sen.cmt: 雅号：用語集の訳に訂正しました。
sen.e: His Gago (pseudonym) was Umetsubo.

sen.j: 略歴
sen.e: Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History

sen.j: 1843年、二条城詰め鉄砲奉行組同心・人見勝之丞（御家人10石3人扶持）の長男として京都市に生まれる。
sen.e: In 1843, he was born in Kyoto as the first son of Katsunojo HITOMI (a vassal with 10 Goku crop yield and an annual three-man rice stipend) who served in Nijo-jo Castle as a teppobugyogumi doshin (a constable in firearms section).

In 1843, he was born in Kyoto as the first son of Katsunojo HITOMI (a vassal with 10 Goku crop yield and an annual three-man rice stipend) who served in Nijo-jo Castle as a teppobugyogumi doshin (a constable in firearms section).

In 1843, he was born in Kyoto as the first son of Katsunojo HITOMI (a vassal with 10 Goku crop yield and an annual three-man rice stipend) who served in Nijo-jo Castle as a teppobugyogumi doshin (a constable in firearms section).

sen.j: 1867年に遊撃隊に入隊する。
sen.e: In 1867, he entered yugekitai (mobile forces).
In 1867, he entered yugekitai (mobile forces).
In 1867, he entered yugekitai (mobile forces).

sen.j: 鳥羽伏見の戦いの敗退後は、江戸へ撤退して徹底抗戦を主張する。
sen.e: After defeated in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, he withdrew to Edo and insisted on making a do-or-die resistance.
After defeated in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, he withdrew to Edo and insisted on making a do-or-die resistance.
After defeated in the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, he withdrew to Edo and insisted on making a do-or-die resistance.

sen.j: 遊撃隊の伊庭八郎ら主戦派とともに房総半島へ移動し、請西藩主林忠崇と合流した。
sen.e: He moved to Boso Peninsula with members in mobile forces who insisted on fighting against enemies including Hachiro IBA and joined with Tadataka HAYASHI, the lord of Jodai Domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: He moved to Boso Peninsula with members of mobile forces who insisted on fighting against enemies including Hachiro IBA and joined with Tadataka HAYASHI, the lord of Joｚai Domain.
sen.cmt: members in ⇒ members of に訂正しました。請西: 用語集にあるJozai に訂正しました。
sen.e: He moved to Boso Peninsula with members of mobile forces who insisted on fighting against enemies including Hachiro IBA and joined with Tadataka HAYASHI, the lord of Joｚai Domain.

sen.j: そして、小田原市や伊豆の国市、箱根などで新政府軍と交戦した。
sen.e: He fought against the new government in several places such as Odawara City, Izunokuni City and Hakone.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: He fought against the new government army in several places such as Odawara City, Izunokuni City and Hakone.
sen.cmt: government ⇒ government army に訂正しました。
sen.e: He fought against the new government army in several places such as Odawara City, Izunokuni City and Hakone.

sen.j: 奥羽越列藩同盟に関与し、北関東から東北地方を転戦した。
sen.e: He participated in Ouetsu Reppan Domei (Northern Alliance or a Japanese military-political coalition) and continued fighting while moving from the North Kanto to Tohoku (the northeast of Japan).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: He participated in Ouetsu Reppan Domei (Northern Alliance or a Japanese military-political coalition) and continued fighting while moving from the North Kanto to Tohoku (the northeast of Japan).
He participated in Ouetsu Reppan Domei (Northern Alliance or a Japanese military-political coalition) and continued fighting while moving from the North Kanto to Tohoku (the northeast of Japan).

sen.j: その後、蝦夷地へ渡って蝦夷共和国の松前奉行に就任した。
sen.e: After that, he moved to Ezo (inhabited area of Ainu) and was assigned as matsumae bugyo (a vassal of Tokugawa Shogunate whose duty was to control the area) of the Republic of Ezo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: After that, he moved to Ezo (inhabited area of Ainu) and was assigned as matsumae bugyo (a vassal of Tokugawa Shogunate whose duty was to control the area) of the Republic of Ezo.
After that, he moved to Ezo (inhabited area of Ainu) and was assigned as matsumae bugyo (a vassal of Tokugawa Shogunate whose duty was to control the area) of the Republic of Ezo.

sen.j: 1869年5月18日、新政府に降伏した。
sen.e: On May 18, 1869, he surrendered to the new government.
On May 18, 1869, he surrendered to the new government.
On May 18, 1869, he surrendered to the new government.

sen.j: 維新後は、静岡県にて英学校を経営する。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, he ran an English school in Shizuoka Prefecture.
After the Meiji Restoration, he ran an English school in Shizuoka Prefecture.
After the Meiji Restoration, he ran an English school in Shizuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: 1876年に大久保利通の推挙により勧業寮に出仕し、製茶業務に従事した。
sen.e: In 1876, he was recommended for being a government officer serving Kanryocho (Agriculture Agency) by Toshimichi Okubo and played an active role in producing Japanese tea.
In 1876, he was recommended by Toshimichi Okubo for serving for Kangyoryo (Industrial Agency) and played an active role in producing Japanese tea.
sen.cmt: Kanryocho (Agriculture Agency) ⇒ Kangyoryo (Industrial Agency) に訂正しました。推挙により：表現・語順を変更しました。
sen.e: In 1876, he was recommended by Toshimichi Okubo for serving for Kangyoryo (Industrial Agency) and played an active role in producing Japanese tea.

sen.j: 1879年に茨城県大書記官、翌年には茨城県令をつとめた。
sen.e: In 1879, he became a public officer in Ibaragi Prefecture and in 1880, he became a governor of Ibaragi Prefecture.
In 1879, he became a great secretary in Ibaraki Prefecture and in 1880, he became a governor of Ibaraki Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 大書記官:用語集の訳に訂正しました。Ibaragi ⇒ Ibaraki に訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1879, he became a great secretary in Ibaraki Prefecture and in 1880, he became a governor of Ibaraki Prefecture.

sen.j: その後は実業界に転じて、サッポロビールの設立に関与し、利根運河社長をつとめた。
sen.e: After that, he turned to be a businessman and played an important roll in establishing Sapporo Breweries Ltd., and then, he became a president of Toneunga (the Tone Canal) Corporation.
After that, he turned to be a businessman and played an important roll in establishing Sapporo Breweries Ltd., and then, he became a president of Toneunga (the Tone Canal) Corporation.
After that, he turned to be a businessman and played an important roll in establishing Sapporo Breweries Ltd., and then, he became a president of Toneunga (the Tone Canal) Corporation.

sen.j: 明治30年代よりたびたび史談会に出席し、幕末維新期に関する談話を残している。
sen.e: Since the 1890's, he often attended meetings where the participants talked about historical incidents and some stories about the last days of the Tokugawa shogunate and Meiji Restoration told there have been handed down for generations.

Since the 1890's, he often attended meetings where the participants talked about historical incidents and some stories about the last days of the Tokugawa shogunate and Meiji Restoration told there have been handed down for generations.

Since the 1890's, he often attended meetings where the participants talked about historical incidents and some stories about the last days of the Tokugawa shogunate and Meiji Restoration told there have been handed down for generations.
In 1922, he died.
He died in 1922.
He died in 1922.

sen.j: 享年80。
sen.e: Died at the age of 80.
He died at the age of 80.
He died at the age of 80.

tit.cmt: 用語集の訳に訂正しました。

sen.j: 箱館戦争時に詠んだもの。
sen.e: He made the following poem at the Hakodate War.
He made the following poem during the Hakodate War.
sen.cmt: at ⇒ during に訂正しました。
sen.e: He made the following poem during the Hakodate War.

sen.j: 幾万官兵海陸来
sen.e: Tens of thousands of army and navel troops of the new government came.
sen.cmt: 俳句 「幾万官兵海陸来 孤軍場戦骸成堆 百籌運尽至今日 好成五稜郭下苦」を一文ずつ意味をとって訳しましたが、正式な訳を見つけ出すことができなかったので、不正確な部分があるかもしれません。 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Tens of thousands of army and navel troops of the new government came.
Tens of thousands of army and navel troops of the new government came.

sen.j: 孤軍場戦骸成堆
sen.e: Our troops cut off from the main force fought a losing battle, causing heavy casualties.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Our troops cut off from the main force fought a losing battle, causing heavy casualties.
Our troops cut off from the main force fought a losing battle, causing heavy casualties.

sen.j: 百籌運尽至今日
sen.e: Our luck finally ran out here.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Our luck finally ran out here.
Our luck finally ran out here.

sen.j: 好成五稜郭下苦
sen.e: We have to accept the surrender in our fortress, Goryokaku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: We have to accept the surrender in our fortress, Goryokaku.
We have to accept the surrender in our fortress, Goryokaku.
